name: Introduction to Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the concepts and challenges of engineering, giving them an overview of the engineering field.

name: Calculus I
description: This course covers the fundamentals of single-variable calculus, including limits, functions, derivatives, integrals, and applications.

name: Calculus II
description: This course covers more advanced single-variable calculus topics, including vector-valued functions, partial derivatives, integration techniques, and applications.

name: Calculus III
description: This course covers more advanced single-variable calculus topics, including vector-valued functions, partial derivatives, integration techniques, and applications.

name: Engineering Mechanics I
description: This course introduces students to the principles of engineering mechanics, including statics, forces, equilibrium, and kinematics.

name: Engineering Mechanics II
description: This course covers more advanced engineering mechanics topics, including dynamics, energy methods, and advanced kinematics.

name: Geotechnical Engineering I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of geotechnical engineering, including soil properties, soil mechanics, and foundation design principles.

name: Geotechnical Engineering II
description: This course covers more advanced geotechnical engineering topics, including slope stability, soil consolidation, and deep foundation design.
